page.title: 17The New Inn Shalfleet
page.content: On July 4th Radio Solent did a broadcast from the snug bar of the{New {Inn.}The building is 400-450 years old and parts date from{Norman times. Nigel and Brenda Simpson are the landlords and the pub recieved praise in{Egon Ronay's Pub Guide. This is a{'Real Ale'}pub with the beer sold direct from the barrel.There is a wide open fireplace with a large chimney and log fire in winter. In summer there is room to put tables and chairs there. Because there is no police station in the village the{nuclear early {warning system}is housed at the pub. Brenda Simpson concentrates on{fish {dishes _}such as garlic clams, mussels, shellfish salads with prawns crab, cockles,mussels and meals with lobsters,oysters and other local fresh fish.
